meanings.definition: A part of a tree that grows out from the trunk
meanings.sent1: The squirrel climbed the branches to reach the acorns.
meanings.sent2: The branches of the oak tree provided shade on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat used the branches as a jungle gym.
meanings.sent4: The branches swayed gently in the breeze like dancers in a ballet.
meanings.sent5: The branches rustled with the songs of the birds perched on them.

meanings.definition: A division or subdivision of something larger
meanings.sent1: The local library has several branches in different neighborhoods.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to open a new branch in the bustling city center.
meanings.sent3: The family tree had many branches, each representing a different generation.
meanings.sent4: The branches of government work together to ensure a balanced system.
meanings.sent5: The branches of the river flowed into various directions, creating a network.

meanings.definition: To spread or divide into separate parts or groups
meanings.sent1: The company plans to branches out into new markets next year.
meanings.sent2: After the merger, the business will branches into different product lines.
meanings.sent3: The idea began to branches into various innovative solutions.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity branches into different forms of art, from painting to sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The project manager decided to branches the tasks among the team members.
